com.esri.mo2.src.cat
Interface ContentProvider

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseContentProvider
public interface ContentProvider

Defines a plugin for CatalogModel. Implementations of this interface define how the CatalogModel will be populated.

See Also:
CatalogModel

Method Summary

Method Detail

getRootPath

public String getRootPath()
the path that nodes constructed by this provider will be placed in. the CatalogModel will construct the necessary tree structure to make this possible

getConnectionType

public String getConnectionType()
identifies the type of the Connection that is supported by this ContentProvider

Returns:
the full class name of the Connection type

initialize

public void initialize()
                throws Exception
gives ContentProvider the opportunity to do some initializations, just after an instance has been added to the list of providers within the CatalogModel

Throws:
Exception - if the ContentProvider experiences any problem while initializing
See Also:
CatalogModel.initialize()

constructContent

public Content[] constructContent(Connection connection)
                           throws IOException
constructs zero or more Content objects for insertion into the root path specified by getRootPath() for the given Connection object. The CatalogModel will call this method when outside code calls the CatalogModel's addConnection() method. This method should first determine if the given Connection is appropriate for the Source/s represented by this ContentProvider.

Typically, for the FileSystem, multiple Content objects might be returned. Other ContentProviders will usually only provide a single Content representing the connection.

Returns:
zero or more Content objects representing the Connection that is to be added to the CatalogModel, or null == the Connection is not supported by this ContentProvider
IOException
See Also:
getRootPath(), CatalogModel.addConnection(com.esri.mo2.src.sys.Connection)

performAction

public void performAction(ContentAction action)
perform a special action on the given Content, typically for use by the user interface Catalog. Does nothing if the action is unsupported, or if the Content was not produced by this ContentProvider.
